# Load File
csv = '../input/co2-emissions-1960-2018/CO2_Emissions_1960-2018.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(csv,index_col='Country Name')

# Fill Blank with 0
df.fillna(0, inplace=True)

# Convert Year columns to int data type
years = df.columns
df.columns = years.astype(int)

# Calculate Overall Mean
df_stat = df.describe()

# Plot Function
def plot(cntry):
    fig = px.line(df.loc[cntry],
                  markers=True,
                  line_shape='spline',
                  title='CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita) for '+cntry,
                  
                  height=900);
    fig.update_layout(showlegend=False,
                      xaxis_title = 'Years',
                      yaxis_title = 'CO2 emissions (metric tons)',
                      title_x=0.5);
    
    #fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(y = [OverallMean]))
    fig.update_yaxes(tickvals=[OverallMean], gridwidth=1, gridcolor='#B02E0C')
    fig.update_xaxes(nticks=15)
    fig.show();

## Conclusion:

* The global CO2 emission average is 3.83 
* China crossed the global average in 2004
* As of 2018, India & Bhutan are below the global average 
* Trinidad and Tobago has been above the global average since 1964
* Norway crossed the global average in 1962
* Israel crossed the global average in 1965
* Countries in UK / USA have been above the global average ever since 1960.
